website_summaries.verdict: Trusted brand and a sleek design and protective cover.
pros: Number 1 choice for those who don't want a silly-looking, yellow corn peeler
Contains a little cover so you can safely store it in a drawer
Most say this tool is clearly better and safer than using a knife
cons: Takes time to get used to how to hold the corn at the right angle

customer_reviews.title: Must have for freezing off the cob sweet corn!
customer_reviews.text: I have been freezing sweet corn all of my life and I can't say enough good things about this product. I have a shoebox full of products that I have tried and now stored away after using this zipper. Used properly(took me a few ears to get the right angle) this enabled me to get 1/3 more corn frozen than in previous years. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Lauri L. Gersdorf

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my wife when I caught her ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife when I caught her trying to remove corn off a cob with a GIANT knife and she had the cob standing on end. She was making a corn soup she enjoys. The entire thing looked dangerous so I bought her this. She loves it by the way. It's all about the right tool for the job.
customer_reviews.author: Maine Geek

customer_reviews.title: it's ok.
customer_reviews.text: It's ok. When using make sure you use a deep wide bowl/pan. If you don't the corn will fly all over. Makes my dogs happy depending where there standing.
customer_reviews.author: JanB.

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Simple and effective - WAY better than the toothed-metal-ring-between-tweezers thingy. Took some practice to get an extremely shallow cut (best for creamed corn). Easily produces whole-kernel niblets as well
customer_reviews.author: Montana Bob

customer_reviews.title: IF you are good with a paring knife, use that instead....
customer_reviews.text: fair, but using a good paring knife does a better job. I got this because my wife's hand was cramping after using the knife all day putting up sweet corn. Her opinion was usable and wouldn't throw out, but a knife worked better.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: I've used this a lot this summer to make corn elote which is easier if the corn is taking off the Cobb. This tool does the trick although is a little tricky keeping it at the best angle rather than dig into the corn. I have found that a sharp pairing knife still works the best and is the easiest to use. Sorry Pampered Chef, I love almost everything I. have purchased.
customer_reviews.author: RaNae Seaton

customer_reviews.title: Works but need some strength to do it.
customer_reviews.text: Works good, but a bit difficult to push through corn if not strong. I had to do it for my wife.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Allen

customer_reviews.title: Best thing ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the best thing ever. I say where has this been all my life. Had to buy one for my mother in law.
customer_reviews.author: Kellie

customer_reviews.title: Love, love
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love. Both my son and I have braces and got to enjoy fresh corn easily all summer with tool!

customer_reviews.title: Love the corn cobbler!
customer_reviews.text: It cuts the corn off the cob like butter! I bought a second one for the camper!

customer_reviews.title: Life saver!
customer_reviews.text: Hate those curnals in ur teeth or just need to get a lot of corn off the cob for freezing or canning? This will be ur best friend! Very sharp, super easy 2 use!

customer_reviews.title: It does the what it is built to do thanks!

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: This is the BEST kernel cutter I have ever used. Easier and much safer than a knife. Don't have to press hard and it gets the "milk" too. My grand children LOVE my creamed corn and this cutter enables these arthritic hands of mine to spoil them.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed. I bought another tool and it worked perfect. I found it very hard to gauge my pressure applied to not get the cob in the corn. It works, but I like my other one better. I was told this was the best tool for cutting corn, and I disagree.

customer_reviews.title: Enables people with bad teeth, dentures or bridgework to eat fresh corn from the cob.

customer_reviews.text: Using a knife to cut the kernels makes such a mess. Just cut the kernels off into a bowl or pot; flip the cutter over to the plastic side and press out the corn milk from the cob.

customer_reviews.text: My life has forever been changed. Cutting corn off the cob use to be an annoyance, not anymore!

customer_reviews.title: HAD TO HAVE ONE OF MY OWN
customer_reviews.text: Neighbor let me borrow hers last fall. Had to get one for myself it worked so well. I had always used a knife as my mother before me, and so on. First slice was occasionally off a little but never into the cob. Probably due to my inexperience as much as anything. Fast, easy, and very efficient. Must always be aware of hand or finger placement on the ear as the cutter is so sharp it would be very unforgiving. Highly recommended tool.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: It has a serrated edge, that does nothing more than shred the corn kernels. The kernels are turned into a pulp. The handle is also too long and it's awkward to run it down the cob. A plain knife does much better; it cuts closer to the cob and at a horizontal angle rather than the vertical angle this tool requires. Don't waste your money.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Literally the best way to get corn off the cob! Slides down the cob effortlessly and I feel a lot safer using this over a knife. Sharp enough to fulfill its purpose and easy to clean and store with a little cover over the end. Love it!

customer_reviews.title: Does the job and is well made.

product_meta.title: Pampered Chef Corn Kernel Cutter - Corn Peeler Thresher Stripper with Large Ergonomic Handle #1114
product_meta.description: The Kernel Cutter's curved and serrated stainless blade quickly removes kernels from cobs, and the plastic husker blade slices through corn silks and husks. The large ergonomic handle provides a comfortable grip and easy maneuverability. To use Kernel Cutter:Remove protective storage cover by lifting tabs on each side of cover and carefully sliding away from blade head. Remove husk using plastic husking blade: Place corn on flat, stable cutting board. Firmly grasp end of cob. Insert plastic blade into husk near base and slice across length of husk towards silk (see illustration 1). Rotate corn and repeat 2 to 3 times. Peel away husk at silk into sections. Cut base of corn with a knife to create a flat, even base. Position cob vertically on flat, stable cutting board. Grasp Kernel Cutter in working hand with head facing downwards and blade facing corn (see illustration 2). Insert blade into corn and carefully push Kernel Cutter from top to bottom of cob to remove kernels. Rotate cob and repeat until all kernels are removed. One year guarantee for noncommercial use.Must contact seller with Amazon receipt.
feature_bullets: Curved, serrated stainless blade quickly removes kernes from cobs
Plastic husker blade slices through corn husks
Large ergonomic handle offers comfort and control

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars214 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
